Hello everyone,
I'm trying out CMS Pages API
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/pages>
but even the simplest one, the first one to get all pages, doesn't seem to be working.
I got and pasted the token of the portal's private app into the request box but I keep on receiving this response:
```HTTP Unknown
undefined```
Anyone knows why?
Thank you.
<@U01QVR44MEY> you're the API man :smile: do you have any useful insights? Thanks!
Running this in postman? Or through the tester?
Through the tester on the page

Just had a chat with support as well, if you ever run into the "*USER_DOES_NOT_HAVE_PERMISSION*" API error, this is the reason:
• This means the request being made, is being made by a user that does not have the permissions to do the call
• This is, because the user that *MADE* the Private App, is deactivated, or does not have the proper edit permissions
• Most API calls will still work, but setting associations with PUT for example will break and give the above error
• What you need to do then is or give that user the proper permissions, or create a new App with the same scope and replace the API keys
Support told me this is because when a association is being made, the user that made the app, is technically set as the creator of the association.
I don't like this, but it's the way it is and want to make sure if someone else runs into this problem, they can find this info here as well.
I'm going to check all apps created by that user now, peace :v:

There's also a community post for this:
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/USER-DOES-NOT-HAVE-PERMISSION-API-error/m-p/798397>
I honestly haven't had a ton of success with that tester, I only use postman for running those tests

Actually the api call is working, I can see it from the network tab of browser dev tools. It's just the tester that's broken, cool :sweat_smile:
Tested on Postman too, it's working.

Now I have another question, though. I hit the endpoint without any parameter, so I'm expecting to retrieve ALL pages (website + landing). I'm seeing 64 results only but on the HS portal I can see 44 website pages and 113 landing pages.
<@U01QVR44MEY> any hints?
maybe drop in the state parameter? `?state__in=PUBLISHED_OR_SCHEDULED`
I bet those are just the published ones

I can't see that parameter in the `/cms/v3/pages/site-pages` endpoint specs here:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/pages>
Besides, I've looked at the results, I can see some that have `currentState: "DRAFT"` too...
anything similar that you're seeing between the pages?

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/pages#state-values>

Here's the state parameter

Aaah! Totally missed that, I dashed right into the endpoints tab. Honestly, now that I've spotted it, I don't like this difference between the two tabs :confused:
Anyway, now it's adding up <@U01QVR44MEY>, thank you!

Since we're on the subject, I'm doing all of this because I have to copy all pages from a production portal to its related sandbox one. After I retrieve all pages' details with GET `/cms/v3/pages/site-pages` , would you suggest using POST *`/cms/v3/pages/site-pages/batch/create`* (with the results of the GET as payload and the access token of the private app of the sandbox portal) to create all the pages in there in one shot?

Thank you.
Yeah I think you can do that but I would probably run it 50 pages at a time
otherwise you'll run into payload and size limits

Hey everyone!

We are building a Workflow using a Google Apps Script which the idea is to connect to HubSpot (either HS Workflow or API). The flow is like this:

1. We download the monthly renewals from HubSpot and import them into Google Sheets
2. In Google Sheets we run some operations for our customers using the Apps Script.
3. Later in the workflow, we want to trigger the import of Deal Creation information from Google Sheets into HubSpot and retrieve the Record ID back into Sheets.
4. This will allow us to create the line items with their respective Record IDs and
5. Finally send those line items into HubSpot to store and update the information for each customer.

• I'm pretty confident this is achievable, but I want to speak with some experts to understand whether it's doable within HubSpot Workflows or if it's better to build a private app using the API. 
• Which option is more reliable, easier to build, maintenance, etc?
Thanks in advance!! :handshake:

Hi Federico,
Any particular reason you want to build it inhouse?
Would recommend using a Google Sheets HubSpot connector like <https://www.superjoin.ai/integrations/HubSpot|Superjoin> to do this. That might be easier.
